Package p2

Class HuffmanCoding

java.lang.Object
p2.HuffmanCoding
public class HuffmanCoding extends Object
The Huffman Encoding Algorithm This is a data compression algorithm designed by David A. Huffman and published in 1952 What it does is it takes a string and by constructing a special binary tree with the frequencies of each character. This tree generates special prefix codes that make the size of each string encoded a lot smaller, thus saving space.
Since:
03/28/2023
Version:
3.0
Author:
Fernando J. Bermudez Medina (Template), Jorge Colon Velez - 843-18-8733 (Implementation)

      public static String load_data(String inputFile)
      Receives a file named in parameter inputFile (including its path), and returns a single string with the contents.
      Parameters:
      inputFile - name of the file to be processed in the path inputData/
      Returns:
      String with the information to be processed

    • compute_fd

      public static Map<String,Integer> compute_fd(String inputString)
      Compute the frequency distribution (hence comoute_fd) of each character in the input string
      Parameters:
      inputString - The input string of the characters who's frequency need to be computed
      Returns:
      A map containing the frequency distribution of each character

    • huffman_tree

      public static BTNode<Integer,String> huffman_tree(Map<String,Integer> fD)
      Constructs the Huffman tree using the frequency distribution map obtained using compute_fd
      Parameters:
      fD - Map containing the frequency distribution
      Returns:
      The root node of the constructed Huffman tree

    • huffman_code

      public static Map<String,String> huffman_code(BTNode<Integer,String> huffmanRoot)
      Constructs the Huffman code map using the Huffman Tree
      Parameters:
      huffmanRoot - The root node of the Huffman Tree
      Returns:
      A map containing the Huffman code for each character

    • encode

      public static String encode(Map<String,String> encodingMap, String inputString)
      Encodes the Huffman Tree using the Huffman code map
      Parameters:
      encodingMap - A map containing the Huffman prefix code for each character
      inputString - The input to be encoded
      Returns:
      The encoded string using the Huffman prefix code

    • process_results

      public static void process_results(Map<String,Integer> fD, Map<String,String> encodedHuffman, String inputData, String output)
      Receives the frequency distribution map, the Huffman Prefix Code HashTable, the input string, and the output string, and prints the results to the screen (per specifications). Output Includes: symbol, frequency and code. Also includes how many bits has the original and encoded string, plus how much space was saved using this encoding algorithm
      Parameters:
      fD - Frequency Distribution of all the characters in input string
      encodedHuffman - Prefix Code Map
      inputData - text string from the input file
      output - processed encoded string

    • decodeHuff

      public static String decodeHuff(String output, Map<String,String> lookupTable)
      Auxiliary Method that decodes the generated string by the Huffman Coding Algorithm Used for output Purposes
      Parameters:
      output - - Encoded String
      lookupTable -
      Returns:
      The decoded String, this should be the original input string parsed from the input file
